discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
D - By default value for primitive Double is 0.0.
Java initialize all number member variables to zero. Only need to instantiate object b with correct answer D.

Selected Answer: AB
The JRE means Java Runtime Environment and as the name says prived the environment to run java applications. Therefore it implements the java vm for your specific platform, which may make java platform independent, but not your specific JRE. You cannot install the mac os JRE on a Windows machine or vice versa. Also It includes a lot of libraries and the java vm runner which is responsible for garbage collection. So in perspective of the possible answers, A and B are the only possible answer.

Selected Answer: BD
JRE interprets bytecode, soyou can run any .class file, also it is platform independent, you can install it on windows, mac, linux, etc

Selected Answer: AB
Java is platform independent, JVM/JRE is not! 
A and B are correct.

Selected Answer: BD
JDK > JRE > JVM
JVM is the instance created when user installs JRE in system. Its used to run files with .class
JDK is used to run files with .java with java compiler.

questions.question_text: Which two statements are true about the Java Runtime Environment (JRE)?

choices.E: You must install the JRE to compile a .java file.
choices.B: It interprets bytecode stored in a .class file.
choices.C: It contains the JDK and Java APIs.
choices.A: It is responsible for garbage collection.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: BD
Read again, please. The answer says "Architecture dependant", no independant.

Selected Answer: BD
Platform Independent
Architecture Independent
Must install correct JDK/JRE as per Arch and Platform to run any java/class file

Selected Answer: D
same signature , that is , method with same name and same number of arguments with same type of arguments
Duplicate add(int x)

Selected Answer: D
same signature , that is , method with same name and same number of arguments with same type of arguments

Selected Answer: D
As said above, you cannot duplicate the name of the method without changing the arguments.

Selected Answer: D
Duplicate Method Signature: The class has two methods with the same name and parameter types but different return types, which is not allowed. The method add(int x) has a conflicting declaration as both public int add(int x) and public void add(int x).
This code compiles properly we can define duplicate methods it will not throw a error in compiling so correct answer is C
